did.unittitle: Charles A. Sink autographed photograph collection 1894-1972
did.abstract: Charles A. Sink was president of University Musical Society. Photographs (mainly autographed portraits) of musical performers, many of whom appeared in performances of the University Musical Society.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was transferred from the University Musical Society (Donor no. 2996).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Charles A. Sink autographed photograph collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Charles A. Sink was an Ann Arbor businessman and civic leader. He was also a long-time president of the University Musical Society, which was responsible for many of the musical program series performed in Ann Arbor at the University of Michigan. These included the May Festival, performances of the Choral Union, and the yearly presentation of Handel's Messiah.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs (mainly autographed portraits) given to Sink in his responsibility as president of the University Musical Society. There are over 550 photographs, most of them are 8" x 10" prints. They have been arranged into two alphabets, one for individual photographs and one for photographs which were originally in an album. The listing includes "see" and "see also" references so that every occurrence of a person can be located whether it is in a file for a different individual or located separately because of size. The exception to this is for some of the group photos for which the group is identified but individuals are not (or their signatures are not legible). Unidentified photographs (there are three) are in a folder at the beginning of Box 1. There is one photograph per folder unless otherwise indicated. Some of the multiples are duplicates.

odd.p: (for further images of Charles Sink see also Caruso, Enrico; Farrar, Geraldine; Garden, Mary; Johnson, Thor; Kreisler, Fritz; Moore, Grace; Ormandy, Eugene; Stracciari, Riccardo; Tucker, Richard)
(see also Box 5 for Michigan Legislature, Senate Concurrent Resolution No. 8 memorial for Dr. Charles A. Sink, January 11, 1973)
(The contents of the album were removed and put into folders; the album belonged to Charles Sink but probably was not compiled by him; some of the photographs were addressed to Miss Helen White)
(item had been attached to verso of photo of ? Joseff)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The political and personal papers of Charles A. Sink have been separately cataloged.
